EmailTemplate.subject: Virtual primary care helps make more meaningful connections
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Addressing “last-mile” patient needs with virtual care Internal Teladoc Health data suggests four out of five working-age adults do not have a strong relationship with a primary care physician.
Whether it’s breathing new life into the patient-provider relationship or creating low-cost alternatives to existing primary care services <[[https://business.teladochealth.com/resources/audio/virtual-care-connections-whats-next-at-the-intersection-of-virtual-primary/?&utm_source=marketo&utm_medium=email&utm_content=baseline&utm_term=hp&utm_campaign=dgn-education&utm_campaign_id=in-text]]>, virtual care is changing the way members experience healthcare. And health plans can play a leading role Check out our interview with Dr. Troy Russell as he explains how virtual and in-person primary care combine to enhance member experiences, improve care and prevent unnecessary costs—and even advance health equity. About Teladoc Health: Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives. Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.
